title: Chris Kluwe: The Courage and Cost of Civil Disobedience
description: Join us for a conversation with former NFL player and author Chris Kluwe, discussing civil disobedience and standing up for beliefs.
raw_text:
Wilkinson College
the heart and soul of Chapman

JOIN US FOR A COMPELLING CONVERSATION WITH

CHRIS KLUWE:
THE COURAGE AND COST OF CIVIL DISOBEDIENCE

FORMER NFL PLAYER AND AUTHOR CHRIS KLUWE WILL DISCUSS THE POWER AND CONSEQUENCES OF CIVIL DISOBEDIENCE

Kluwe was recently handcuffed, arrested and forcibly removed from a Huntington Beach City Council meeting while opposing the use of public funds to promote MAGA ideology at the local library. In this question-and-answer session, Kluwe will share his experiences with civil disobedience, the personal and professional risks of standing up for one's beliefs, and what it truly means to fight for democracy in today's America. Don't miss this timely discussion on courage and the price of dissent.

THURSDAY APRIL 24 4PM TO 5PM ARGYROS FORUM 208

CHAPMAN UNIVERSITY
Wilkinson College of Arts, Humanities, and Social Sciences

title: Day of Rest-Istance
description: We are gathering to unite workers against exploitation, defend our rights, and take back power amidst threats from ICE and governmental defunding.
raw_text:
WE ARE ALL WORKERS - TAKE YOUR POWER BACK - WE ARE ALL WORKERS - TAKE YOUR POWER BACK - WE ARE ALL WORKERS -
MAYDAY! MAYDAY! WORKERS UNDER ATTACK
KILMAR ABREGO GARCIA - ALFREDO “LELO” JUAREZ - ROBERT PANTON - JOSE DANIEL SIMANCAS RODRIGUEZ
Immigrant workers are going missing, being disappeared in broad daylight by the modern American gestapo called ICE. Enemies of state? No, regular people like you and me being dehumanized for profit and political gain.
An injury to one is an injury to us all!
Whose name will be next on Trump’s list of “undesirables”?
Meanwhile, federal workers of essential programs are recklessly dismissed - The workforces of the National Labor Relations Board, The Department of Labor and National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health have been slashed, threatening the livelihood of millions and plunging our country into chaos. Child labor laws are being repealed under the guise of freedom. Why is this happening? To strengthen the working class? No, to pad their bottom line and increase their profits!
Project 2025 seeks to defund the National Labor Relations Board and the Department of Labor to make it easier for businesses to exploit you, the worker.
Will you silently comply, hoping it all works out? Will you watch your coworkers and friends be disappeared and do nothing? Or will you speak up, show up, and take your power back? Resist exploitation and oppression! Workers unite! Defend your rights!
THEY DON’T LIVE PAYCHECK TO PAYCHECK - WHY SHOULD YOU? - THEY NEED US - REMIND THEM
DAY OF REST-ISTANCE MAY 1ST
PSU FARMERS MARKET - 1PM TO 5PM

description: Join us in Washington, D.C. for the Patriot Protest on the 4th of July. This is a non-violent day of action by, for, and of the people. Spread the news and participate in making a difference.
